javaslang.control

Interface Match<R>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - The result type of the Match.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<Object,R>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Match.Case, Match.Expression

    public interface Match<R>
extends Function<Object,R>
    Match is a better switch for Java. Some characteristics of Match are:
    • it has a fluent API
    • it is a Function<Object, R>
    • it is able to match types, i.e. Match.when((byte b) -> "a byte: " + b)
    • it is able to match values, i.e. Match.when(BigDecimal.ZERO, b -> "Zero: " + b)
    Example of a Match as partial function: 
     
 final Match<Number> toNumber = Match.as(Number.class)
     .when((Integer i) -> i)
     .when((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s));
 final Number number = toNumber.apply(1.0d); // throws a MatchError
    Example of a Match as total function: 
     
 Match.as(Number.class)
     .when((Integer i) -> i)
     .when((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s))
     .otherwise(() -> -1)
     .apply(1.0d); // result: -1
    Since:
    1.0.0

      A function f: byte -> R that takes a primitive byte value and returns a value of type R.
      static class  Match.Case<R>
      A Match.Case which matches an Object by type or by value.
      static interface  Match.CharFunction<R>
      A function f: char -> R that takes a primitive char value and returns a value of type R.
      static interface  Match.DoubleFunction<R>
      A function f: double -> R that takes a primitive double value and returns a value of type R.
      static class  Match.Expression<R>
      A final Match expression which may be applied to an Object.
      static interface  Match.FloatFunction<R>
      A function f: float -> R that takes a primitive float value and returns a value of type R.
      static interface  Match.IntFunction<R>
      A function f: int -> R that takes a primitive int value and returns a value of type R.
      static interface  Match.LongFunction<R>
      A function f: long -> R that takes a primitive long value and returns a value of type R.
      static interface  Match.ShortFunction<R>
      A function f: short -> R that takes a primitive short value and returns a value of type R.
      static class  Match.Typed<R>
      The result of Match.as(Class), which explicitly sets the Match result type.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        R apply(Object o)
        Applies this Match to an Object.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface Function<Object,R>
        Parameters:
        o - an Object
        Throws:
        MatchError - if no Case matched

      • as

        static <R> Match.Typed<R> as(Class<R> type)
        Specifies the type of the match expression. In many cases it is not necessary to call as. This method is intended to be used for readability reasons when the upper bound of the cases cannot be inferred, i.e. instead of 
         
 final Match<Number> toNumber = Match
         .<Number> when((Integer i) -> i)
         .when((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s))
        we write 
         
 final Match<Number> toNumber = Match.as(Number.class)
         .when((Integer i) -> i)
         .when((String s) -> new BigDecimal(s))
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the Match expression
        Parameters:
        type - the hint of type R
        Returns:
        a new match builder
